noun.description: An act of going or coming in.
examples: the door was locked, but he forced an entry

noun.description: An item written or printed in a diary, list, ledger, or reference book.
A person or thing competing in a race or competition.
examples: from the hundreds of entries we received, twelve winners were finally chosen

noun.description: The forward part of a ship's hull below the waterline, considered in terms of breadth or narrowness.

origin: Middle English: from Old French entree, based on Latin intrata, feminine past participle of intrare (see enter).
